algorithm_technique: Selection algorithm (like IntroSelect) to find k-th and (n-k)-th smallest elements
problem_summary_simple: Calculate the mean of an array after removing the smallest and largest 5% of elements.
problem_summary_technical: Uses a selection algorithm to find the bounds for trimming, then calculates the mean of the remaining elements.
key_insights: The problem requires removing a fixed percentage (5%) from both ends of the sorted array.
Instead of a full sort (O(n log n)), a selection algorithm (like Quickselect or IntroSelect) can find the k-th smallest element in O(n) on average.
The solution uses `nth_element` twice to find the boundaries of the elements to keep.
